topics.body:
I'm just talking about random shit:
I think furries might become popular in the long run.

I know google trends is a terrible way of gauging popularity of something, but it's the best way of determining how many people at least google it or such.

A bit of random information to know where I'm coming from; on average people are furries for only five years.  It's been 16 years since shit started going down so almost all of the people who are responsible for giving the fandom the bad reputation are gone.  For years the fandom was in decline then around 2007 the popularity has shown consistent slow growth and in december there was a large scale spike then it's showing larger growth.  Basically imagine popularity vs time as like a long U shape.  I'm not saying in five years or such it will be popular, but in the long run it might be considering how growth seems to be getting larger rather than slower.

Tl:dr; in say 10 years furries might become popular; my money is on 10-15 years, it *MIGHT* be 5-10 years but don't get too excited.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558f15db6368725b2a0000c2#post_558f15db6368725b2a0000c2
It's just opinion, but considering that furries and fnaf are cool with each other that might bump up furries popularity by proxy.

If Fnaf movie is popular it might by proxy increase popularity of furries.
IF the Fnaf movie is popular enough to warrant a second movie that would further increase the popularity by proxy.
IF it's so popular that there's a third movie then I'd argue that would make furries widely popular by proxy.

It might or might not happen depending on whether or not the movie is successful.

To use that would be like how Dragonballz/pokemon/sailor moon,etc made anime popular in the usa.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558f183b63687263a20003c3#post_558f183b63687263a20003c3
Fandoms usually explode into popularity in their initial phases. After that, most fandoms decline and die from there. This is usually the case with many movie fandoms. But if the fandoms survive the initial slump from the aftermath of the big bang, they usually live on for decades, like this fandom is likely going to be.

... I wish we can bring back those days when we were conquering swaths of the internet.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558f18f86368725fe3000503#post_558f18f86368725fe3000503
Awwww the good ole days. It was fun. You don't see as much cool shizness come out of this fandom like you used too.

Nearly all the guys that were huge in this fandom have moved on.

Hell look at JJ. Dude hasn't drawn hardly anything pony related whatsoever. He even gave up on his Lewd art of this show. But we all know why that is...Not even going to go there.

He did draw something in celebration of the 100th episode though.

At some point we really should give out other sites we use.
